topic.title: Footnotes

fn.p: The reference to the Framework is to IASC’s Framework for the Preparation and Presentation of Financial Statements, adopted by the IASB in 2001. In September 2010 the IASB replaced the Framework with the Conceptual Framework for Financial Reporting.

All expenditure on developing a web site solely or primarily for promoting and advertising an entity’s own products and services is recognised as an expense when incurred in accordance with IAS 38.68.

p.line-through: as revised by the IASB in 2003 requires all subsequent costs to be covered by its general recognition principle and eliminated the requirement to reference the originally assessed standard of performance. IAS 38 was amended as a consequence of the change to IAS 16 and the paragraphs specifically referred to were eliminated. This paragraph has been struck through to avoid any confusion.

p.u: The new text was added by IFRS 3 Business Combinations in 2004.
IFRS 13 Fair Value Measurement, issued in May 2011, defines fair value
and contains the requirements for measuring fair value. IFRS 13 defines an active market.
